page.title: 02STOKE DOYLE VILLAGE
page.content: Stoke Doyle is a small village about three miles south-west of{Oundle.}On the east side is the River Nene. The population of the village is eighty. It contains fourteen houses,a church, two farms but not much else.The land is fairly flat and covered with arable crops.Seven Wells farm has 66O acres.Its main crops are barley and wheat.The farmer - Mr.Knight _ employs seven men and works the land with his brother. The church is called Saint Rumbold's parish church.It was re-built in 1727.It can hold up to 175 people with all seats filled.The vicar is the reverend J.R.Roberts. The village has a pub called the Shuckburgh Arms and a disused school, built in 1872.
